answers.answer: I did mine annually. If there is an issue, more frequently. Once a pituitary patient, always a pituitary patient.

question: Hi,A little background.  I was diagnosed with pituitary microadenoma about 5 mm in 2002.  I had repeat MRI in 2004, with no significant change, and MRI in 2006 with no significant change.  In 2008 I tried to get pregnant and it was found I had very high prolactin levels.  I was put on bromocriptine and got pregnant easily. Had Gestational diabetes and other complications, but all finally ok. Had my baby February 2009.  Tested prolactin levels 1 time since delivering my baby and they were normal range.I have been hypothryoid for 10 years now.  Very low TSH, but other hormones ok with treatment.   No noticeable visual symptoms except occassional occular migraines (unrelated I think) and a major color difference / light sensitivity between eyes (maybe just me).I saw a neuroopthamologist middle of last year for visual field testing - which showed all was normal.  He recommended a repeat MRI.  I didn't do that considering cost.So my question is considering that it is a microadenoma and apparently stable, is it necessary / recommended to do MRI so often.  How often would be recommended for monitoring purposes?
title: How frequent MRI
